questions.question: Is the Coca-Cola bottle present in the advertisement with its distinctive curved shape and visible partial logo?
questions.explanation: In Image B, the visual cues show a backdrop that resembles a stylized comic noir setting, likely intended as a parody or fictional situation. The overall design is different from a traditional advertisement, suggesting the absence of any soda bottle. Given these observations, the distinctive bottle shape and logo seen in typical advertisements are not apparent here.

questions.question: Is the white earbud visible in the woman’s ear with the wire extending downward?
questions.explanation: Image B features a noir-themed illustration with a focus on a man amidst dark cityscapes absent any earbud details as would be present in realistic photography. Thus, no earbud can be identified.

questions.question: Are both the man and the woman shown in profile, facing to the right?
questions.explanation: Within Image B, the artistic presentation includes only one main character prominently positioned as if reading, typical in noir settings without depicting multiple individuals side-by-side. Thus, the concept of two figures facing the same direction can be ruled out.

questions.question: Is the man’s right hand positioned near his ear, holding the earbud in a manner that mimics the woman’s use?
questions.explanation: In Image B, the noir illustration captures the man holding an object within the setting of intrigue or investigation typical of noir imagery. The absence of earbuds suggests a different item or gesture rather than mimicking earbud usage.

questions.question: Is the top-right corner of the advertisement visibly torn or peeling, revealing the underlying surface?
